intro: Hatiora herminiae, commonly known as the Christmas star or the star of Bethlehem, is a species of flowering plant in the Apocynaceae family. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in winter. The plant has thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle, which helps it retain moisture in its native habitat. It produces bright orange or yellow flowers that are typically borne on long, slender pedicels. Hatiora herminiae is a popular houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
